Age: Student Study Habits and Exam Performance Dataset
I designed a simple survey questionnaire and collected data from 50 students at my university. Each student was asked about their age
Exam_Result: and exam results. Based on the exam results
Pass_Fail: students were also categorized as pass or fail.

Age: This dataset includes several features that describe students’ study habits and behavior. The features are age
Attendance: and attendance percentage. These features provide information about how students manage their time and how regularly they attend classes.

Age: The label of the dataset is Pass_Fail
Gender: which is derived from the exam result. It indicates whether a student passed or failed the exam.

Age: This dataset is treated as a classification problem
Gender: where the goal is to predict whether a student will pass or fail based on their study habits and attendance.

Age: The dataset contains 51 rows and 7 columns. Each row represents one student
Gender: and each column represents a specific feature related to the student’s study habits or exam performance.

Age: The dataset contains several data quality issues that are commonly found in real-world data. Some rows have missing values
Gender: especially in the Study_Hours and Internet_Hours columns
Study_Hours: because not all students provided complete information.

Age: There are also categorical values such as gender and pass/fail
Gender: which need to be converted into numerical form before using the data in a machine learning model. In addition
Study_Hours: there may be minor inconsistencies in how data is entered
Internet_Hours: such as differences in letter case.

Gender: where the number of students who passed the exam is higher than those who failed. This can affect classification results if not handled properly.

Age: This dataset can be used in a machine learning classification project. The main goal is to predict whether a student will pass or fail an exam based on their study habits
It can also be used for a regression task by predicting the exam result score instead of pass or fail. In addition
Gender: the dataset can be applied to clustering
Study_Hours: where students can be grouped based on similar study behaviors
Internet_Hours: such as high study hours with low internet usage or low attendance with poor performance.
